title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0190

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: And today we have an elementary level lesson about food, one of my favorite things to talk about.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节关于食物的初级课程，这是我最喜欢的话题之一。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We are going to talk about food, but specifically we're going to talk about a family barbecue.
segments.cn: 我们要谈论食物，但具体来说是家庭烧烤。

segments.en: Okay, what is a family barbecue?
segments.cn: 好的，家庭烧烤是什么？

segments.en: Well, I'll just say a few words first.
segments.cn: 嗯，我先说几句话。

segments.en: A barbecue is usually something that we do outside.
segments.cn: 烧烤通常是在户外进行的。

segments.en: We bring food, we play games, maybe have some drinks, and a lot of the food is grilled.
segments.cn: 我们带食物，玩游戏，可能喝点饮料，很多食物都是烤的。

segments.en: So that's what we're talking about today.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们今天要谈的。

segments.en: We're going to hear this dialogue first, and then we'll come back to talk about it.
segments.cn: 我们先听这个对话，然后再回来讨论。

segments.en: Is everything ready for the big family barbecue tomorrow?
segments.cn: 明天的大型家庭烧烤一切准备好了吗？

segments.en: Yep, the steaks and chicken are marinated, and I also bought hamburger buns.
segments.cn: 是的，牛排和鸡肉已经腌制好了，我还买了汉堡包。

segments.en: We should also cook a couple dozen hot dogs and kebabs.
segments.cn: 我们还应该烤几打热狗和烤肉串。

segments.en: Yeah, good idea.
segments.cn: 是的，好主意。

segments.en: We could put some lawn furniture outside next to the grill.
segments.cn: 我们可以把一些户外家具放在烤架旁边。

segments.en: I also set up the tent outside so we can hide from the sun if it gets too hot.
segments.cn: 我还在外面搭了帐篷，以便如果天气太热可以躲避阳光。

segments.en: Great.
segments.cn: 太好了。

segments.en: I asked Grace to bring cups and serviettes as she is also bringing two big coolers for the beers.
segments.cn: 我让Grace带杯子和餐巾纸，因为她还带了两个大冰箱装啤酒。

segments.en: This is going to be a great barbecue.
segments.cn: 这将是一次很棒的烧烤。

segments.en: Oh no, it's raining.
segments.cn: 哦不，下雨了。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So probably a couple of words you didn't really understand, so let's take a look at those now in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 可能有几个词你不太理解，所以现在我们来看看这些词的语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: Lots of food words, Marco.
segments.cn: 很多食物相关的词，Marco。

segments.en: The first one is barbecue.
segments.cn: 第一个是烧烤。

segments.en: We were talking about that a minute ago.
segments.cn: 我们刚才在谈论这个。

segments.en: A barbecue is something we do usually for something on a special occasion or for dinner.
segments.cn: 烧烤通常是在特殊场合或晚餐时进行的。

segments.en: It's a summertime thing.
segments.cn: 这是夏天的活动。

segments.en: You know, you go outside when it's warm, and the entire family comes and we have food.
segments.cn: 你知道，当天气温暖时，你会出去，整个家庭聚在一起吃饭。

segments.en: Sometimes people even bring food.
segments.cn: 有时人们甚至会带食物。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And actually, as you mentioned, it's something that you do a barbecue.
segments.cn: 实际上，正如你提到的，烧烤是一个名词。

segments.en: You have a family barbecue, but it's also a verb.
segments.cn: 你有家庭烧烤，但它也是一个动词。

segments.en: To barbecue something.
segments.cn: 烧烤某样东西。

segments.en: So to cook meat on a barbecue.
segments.cn: 所以在烧烤上烹饪肉。

segments.en: So that's cooking meat not in a stove, not with gas.
segments.cn: 这意味着不在炉子上，不用燃气。

segments.en: Usually it's under a fire or very warm intense heat coming from coals.
segments.cn: 通常是在火下或来自煤炭的强烈热量下。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And so before we cook food, usually before we cook meat on the grill, before we barbecue it, we have to marinate it.
segments.cn: 所以在我们烹饪食物之前，通常在我们在烤架上烹饪肉之前，我们必须腌制它。

segments.en: Okay, so in this situation, the steaks and the chicken are already marinated.
segments.cn: 好的，在这种情况下，牛排和鸡肉已经腌制好了。

segments.en: Okay, so to marinate something or which is so to marinate something, which is a verb or the steaks and chickens are marinated, which is an adjective.
segments.cn: 好的，腌制某样东西，或者说牛排和鸡肉是腌制的，前者是动词，后者是形容词。

segments.en: So basically means that you have added spices and maybe some lemon juice, different herbs or salts to the meats in order to give it flavor before you cook them.
segments.cn: 基本上意味着你已经添加了香料，也许还有一些柠檬汁、不同的香草或盐，以便在烹饪之前给肉增添风味。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Sometimes in Indian cooking, for example, you marinate with a yogurt sauce and you leave the meats in the refrigerator for a whole night.
segments.cn: 有时在印度烹饪中，例如，你用酸奶酱腌制，并把肉放在冰箱里过夜。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So marinating or to marinate is a process to give flavor to food.
segments.cn: 所以腌制或腌制是给食物增添风味的过程。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: All right, so we've marinated our food, our chicken, our steaks, but also we have hamburgers.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们已经腌制了我们的食物，鸡肉和牛排，但我们还有汉堡。

segments.en: So we need hamburger buns.
segments.cn: 所以我们需要汉堡包。

segments.en: What are buns?
segments.cn: 什么是包子？

segments.en: Okay, buns are pieces of bread that are for special kinds of food.
segments.cn: 好的，包子是用于特殊食物的面包。

segments.en: So you have a hamburger bun.
segments.cn: 所以你有一个汉堡包。

segments.en: It's a round piece of bread and the hamburger goes on one piece and under another piece.
segments.cn: 它是一个圆形的面包，上面放一个汉堡，下面再放一个。

segments.en: A hot dog bun is different.
segments.cn: 热狗包是不同的。

segments.en: It's like a piece of bread that's folded and the hot dog goes in the middle.
segments.cn: 它像一块折叠的面包，热狗放在中间。

segments.en: So bun is a special kind of bread for these kinds of foods.
segments.cn: 所以包子是这些食物的特殊面包。

segments.en: All right, so remember if you want to have a hot dog, you need to buy hot dog buns.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以记住，如果你想吃热狗，你需要买热狗包。

segments.en: So people know already that you're talking about bread.
segments.cn: 所以人们已经知道你在谈论面包。

segments.en: And if you want to buy a hamburger bread, you say a hamburger bun.
segments.cn: 如果你想买汉堡面包，你说汉堡包。

segments.en: That's right, so hamburger buns and hot dog buns.
segments.cn: 没错，所以汉堡包和热狗包。

segments.en: But after we talk about having the hamburger buns, we discuss how many hot dogs are going to cook.
segments.cn: 但在我们谈论汉堡包之后，我们讨论要烤多少热狗。

segments.en: So the person says, we should cook a couple dozen hot dogs.
segments.cn: 所以那个人说，我们应该烤几打热狗。

segments.en: All right, so a dozen is 12 units of something.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以一打是12个单位。

segments.en: Right, so eggs are sold in dozens.
segments.cn: 对，所以鸡蛋是按打出售的。

segments.en: We buy a dozen eggs, we buy 12 eggs.
segments.cn: 我们买一打鸡蛋，我们买12个鸡蛋。

segments.en: Okay, or you can say half a dozen.
segments.cn: 好吧，或者你可以说半打。

segments.en: That means six.
segments.cn: 那意味着六个。

segments.en: Half of 12.
segments.cn: 12的一半。

segments.en: And a couple dozen is usually around 24, 25.
segments.cn: 而几打通常是24、25个。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So a dozen hot dogs and they are also getting kebabs.
segments.cn: 所以一打热狗，他们还要烤肉串。

segments.en: What are kebabs?
segments.cn: 什么是烤肉串？

segments.en: Mmm, one of my favorite foods.
segments.cn: 嗯，我最喜欢的食物之一。

segments.en: Kebabs are sticks or skewers of meat.
segments.cn: 烤肉串是肉的棍子或串。

segments.en: So you have a very thin stick and you put the meat on it and you put that on the grill and you cook the meat on the grill.
segments.cn: 所以你有一根很细的棍子，把肉放在上面，然后把它放在烤架上烹饪。

segments.en: Mm-hmm, so yeah, those are very common.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，这些非常常见。

segments.en: For example, in the Middle East, right, you have kebabs, sticks of meat, and also maybe some vegetables put on it, and you grill them.
segments.cn: 例如，在中东，你有烤肉串，肉串上可能还有一些蔬菜，然后你把它们烤熟。

segments.en: Exactly, very flavorful, very tasty meat.
segments.cn: 正是如此，非常美味，非常可口的肉。

segments.en: All right, so why don't we listen to our dialogue again and we'll come back shortly to look at some more words.
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们再听一次对话，然后我们很快回来看看更多的单词。

segments.en: Is everything ready for the big family barbecue tomorrow?
segments.cn: 明天的大型家庭烧烤一切准备好了吗？

segments.en: Yep, the steaks and chicken are marinated and I also bought hamburger buns.
segments.cn: 是的，牛排和鸡肉已经腌制好了，我还买了汉堡包。

segments.en: We should also cook a couple dozen hot dogs and kebabs.
segments.cn: 我们还应该烤几打热狗和烤肉串。

segments.en: Yeah, good idea.
segments.cn: 是的，好主意。

segments.en: We could put some lawn furniture outside next to the grill.
segments.cn: 我们可以把一些户外家具放在烤架旁边。

segments.en: I also set up the tent outside so we can hide from the sun if it gets too hot.
segments.cn: 我还在外面搭了帐篷，以便如果天气太热可以躲避阳光。

segments.en: Great!
segments.cn: 太好了！

segments.en: I asked Grace to bring cups and serve yetz as she is also bringing two big coolers for the beers.
segments.cn: 我让Grace带杯子和餐巾纸，因为她还带了两个大冰箱装啤酒。

segments.en: This is gonna be a great barbecue.
segments.cn: 这将是一次很棒的烧烤。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now why don't we go to a second part of language takeaway and take a look at five more words.
segments.cn: 现在我们为什么不去第二部分的语言要点，看看五个更多的单词。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: All right, the first word that we're gonna look at is lawn furniture.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们要看的第一个词是户外家具。

segments.en: So we're gonna have lawn furniture outside.
segments.cn: 所以我们要在外面放户外家具。

segments.en: Okay, so before we even start thinking about food, we have to decide where people will sit at this barbecue.
segments.cn: 好的，在我们开始考虑食物之前，我们必须决定人们在这个烧烤上坐在哪里。

segments.en: And so we have to find out how much lawn furniture we have.
segments.cn: 所以我们必须找出我们有多少户外家具。

segments.en: Furniture can be a sofa, a table, a chair.
segments.cn: 家具可以是沙发、桌子、椅子。

segments.en: We have furniture in the house, but lawn furniture is furniture for the outside.
segments.cn: 我们在家里有家具，但户外家具是用于户外的家具。

segments.en: A lawn is the green grass outside your house.
segments.cn: 草坪是你家外面的绿色草地。

segments.en: So it's usually not gonna be made out of wood, for example, because if it rains, it might get ruined, right?
segments.cn: 所以通常不会用木头做，比如说，因为如果下雨，它可能会坏，对吧？

segments.en: So usually it's either plastic or maybe even rock or stone or metal or metal.
segments.cn: 所以通常是塑料，或者甚至是石头或金属。

segments.en: So that's what lawn furniture is.
segments.cn: 这就是户外家具。

segments.en: Furniture that is made to be outside in your backyard, for example, or that sits on your lawn.
segments.cn: 是为你的后院或草坪外面设计的家具。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And so we're going to be on the lawn furniture.
segments.cn: 所以我们将使用户外家具。

segments.en: We have the special thing for cooking meat outside, the grill.
segments.cn: 我们有专门用于户外烹饪肉类的东西，烧烤架。

segments.en: Okay, so we mentioned that you grill chicken or you grill steaks, but it's also a noun, a grill.
segments.cn: 好的，我们提到过你可以烤鸡肉或牛排，但它也是一个名词，烧烤架。

segments.en: So a grill, what is that?
segments.cn: 烧烤架是什么？

segments.en: A grill is like a stove for the outside, but instead of having electricity to make the fire, we have gas or propane.
segments.cn: 烧烤架就像是户外的炉子，但不是用电来生火，而是用气体或丙烷。

segments.en: And this is something that we light on fire and we use coals to keep the insides very warm.
segments.cn: 这是我们点燃的东西，我们用煤炭保持内部非常温暖。

segments.en: And so this is just a way to cook meats or even vegetables outside.
segments.cn: 这只是用来在户外烹饪肉类或蔬菜的一种方式。

segments.en: Okay, perfect.
segments.cn: 好的，完美。

segments.en: So that is a grill.
segments.cn: 所以这就是烧烤架。

segments.en: And if you're going to cook foods or vegetables in this way, so you're going to grill them.
segments.cn: 如果你要用这种方式烹饪食物或蔬菜，那就是烤它们。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And well, just in case it gets hot and you wanna hide from the sun, we are going to set up a tent.
segments.cn: 如果天气热，你想躲避阳光，我们将搭建一个帐篷。

segments.en: Okay, a tent, you can sleep in a tent, but in this case, a tent is just a covering outside.
segments.cn: 好的，帐篷，你可以在帐篷里睡觉，但在这种情况下，帐篷只是外面的遮盖物。

segments.en: So maybe some cloth or some fabric that will stand over us when we sit down or want to be outside.
segments.cn: 所以可能是一些布或织物，当我们坐下或想在外面时，它会在我们上方。

segments.en: It's also a way to protect us from the rain.
segments.cn: 这也是保护我们免受雨水的一种方式。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So as you mentioned, a tent is something that you set up temporarily made out of cloth or plastic to protect you from the sun or rain.
segments.cn: 正如你提到的，帐篷是你临时搭建的，用布或塑料制成的，以保护你免受阳光或雨水。

segments.en: Or if you're going camping, you sleep in one.
segments.cn: 或者如果你去露营，你可以在里面睡觉。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And now that they have all the food, they need cups.
segments.cn: 现在他们有了所有的食物，他们需要杯子。

segments.en: And then they mentioned the strange word.
segments.cn: 然后他们提到了一个奇怪的词。

segments.en: It kind of sounds French.
segments.cn: 听起来有点像法语。

segments.en: Cerviettes.
segments.cn: Cerviettes。

segments.en: Cerviettes.
segments.cn: Cerviettes。

segments.en: So I do think it comes from the French word.
segments.cn: 我确实认为它来自法语单词。

segments.en: This is a British way of saying napkins.
segments.cn: 这是英国人说餐巾纸的方式。

segments.en: So it's like paper for cleaning your hands and cleaning your mouth that you throw away.
segments.cn: 所以这就像是用来擦手和嘴的纸，使用后可以扔掉。

segments.en: Okay, so you can say napkins or if you wanna sound a little bit more fancier, you can say Cerviettes.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你可以说餐巾纸，或者如果你想听起来更高档一点，可以说Cerviettes。

segments.en: And speaking of fancy, let's talk about beer.
segments.cn: 说到高档，我们来谈谈啤酒。

segments.en: Where do we keep beer?
segments.cn: 我们把啤酒放在哪里？

segments.en: It has to stay cold, right?
segments.cn: 它必须保持冷却，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So usually you would place it in a refrigerator.
segments.cn: 所以通常你会把它放在冰箱里。

segments.en: But if you're outside or you're going camping, you wanna keep them cold or you wanna keep something hot.
segments.cn: 但如果你在外面或者去露营，你想保持它们冷却，或者想保持某些东西热。

segments.en: You place it in a cooler.
segments.cn: 你把它放在冷却箱里。

segments.en: Okay, so a cooler is a plastic bin or a plastic box that we put all of the ice in and the drinks.
segments.cn: 好的，所以冷却箱是一个塑料箱或塑料盒，我们把所有的冰和饮料放进去。

segments.en: So it's not just for beer.
segments.cn: 所以这不仅仅是为了啤酒。

segments.en: It's also for Coke and Sprite and all these different drinks.
segments.cn: 这也是为了可乐、雪碧和所有这些不同的饮料。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So it's usually made to keep something cool.
segments.cn: 所以它通常是为了保持某些东西冷却。

segments.en: But as I said, if you wanna keep something warm, you can also keep it in the cooler.
segments.cn: 但正如我所说，如果你想保持某些东西温暖，你也可以把它放在冷却箱里。

segments.en: It keeps the temperature of the foods.
segments.cn: 它保持食物的温度。

segments.en: And the nice thing is that it's not electric so you can use it anywhere.
segments.cn: 好的，好的地方是它不是电动的，所以你可以在任何地方使用。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So that's all the words for today.
segments.cn: 所以今天的词就到这里。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue for the last time?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不最后再听一次我们的对话？

segments.en: Is everything ready for the big family barbecue tomorrow?
segments.cn: 明天的大型家庭烧烤一切准备好了吗？

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: The steaks and chicken are marinated and I also bought hamburger buns.
segments.cn: 牛排和鸡肉已经腌制好，我还买了汉堡包。

segments.en: We should also cook a couple dozen hot dogs and kebabs.
segments.cn: 我们还应该烤几打热狗和烤肉串。

segments.en: Yeah, good idea.
segments.cn: 是的，好主意。

segments.en: We could put some lawn furniture outside next to the grill.
segments.cn: 我们可以把一些户外家具放在烧烤架旁边。

segments.en: I also set up the tent outside so we can hide from the sun if it gets too hot.
segments.cn: 我还在外面搭了帐篷，这样如果天气太热，我们可以躲避阳光。

segments.en: Great.
segments.cn: 太好了。

segments.en: I asked Grace to bring cups and serve yetz as she is also bringing two big coolers for the beers.
segments.cn: 我让Grace带杯子和餐巾纸，因为她还带了两个大冷却箱装啤酒。

segments.en: This is gonna be a great barbecue.
segments.cn: 这将是一个很棒的烧烤。

segments.en: Oh no, it's raining.
segments.cn: 哦不，下雨了。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So family barbecues and doing these things.
segments.cn: 所以家庭烧烤和做这些事情。

segments.en: Did you do these when you were young at home?
segments.cn: 你年轻时在家里做过这些吗？

segments.en: Do you still like to do it?
segments.cn: 你还喜欢这样做吗？

segments.en: All the time I love barbecues.
segments.cn: 我一直都喜欢烧烤。

segments.en: It's one of my favorite ways to eat food.
segments.cn: 这是我最喜欢的吃饭方式之一。

segments.en: The nice thing about a barbecue is you get to sit outside and relax and there's nothing better than nice fresh grilled meat.
segments.cn: 烧烤的好处是你可以坐在外面放松，没有什么比新鲜烤肉更好的了。

segments.en: Right and well you have all your friends over so you're having a couple of beers and you're having some meat and it's actually a really nice way of just having something at home with good friends and family, right?
segments.cn: 对，而且你有所有的朋友在一起，所以你喝几杯啤酒，吃一些肉，这实际上是和好朋友和家人在家里享受的一个很好的方式，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And some of the most important barbecues we have are in the summer near July 4th.
segments.cn: 我们最重要的烧烤之一是在夏天，接近7月4日。

segments.en: And so people like to have July 4th barbecues where you celebrate Independence Day and sit outside and drink and have hot dogs and hamburgers and macaroni and cheese.
segments.cn: 所以人们喜欢在7月4日烧烤，庆祝独立日，坐在外面喝酒，吃热狗、汉堡和通心粉奶酪。

segments.en: Actually while I was in Chile, I noticed that as well near their festivities for their independence, which is September 18th.
segments.cn: 实际上，当我在智利时，我也注意到他们在9月18日的独立日庆祝活动期间，很多人聚在一起烧烤，这非常流行，以至于几乎每个邻居的房子在周末都能闻到烧烤的味道。

segments.en: A lot of people get together and have barbecues and it's so so popular that pretty much every house in the neighborhood you can smell somebody barbecuing on the weekend.
segments.cn: 你让我好饿。

segments.en: You're making me so hungry.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，如果你们有任何问题、疑虑，或者在你们的家乡烧烤是否常见，为什么不在EnglishPod.com给我们发几条评论，我们会在那里见到大家。

segments.en: Alright guys, so if you have any questions, any doubts or if it's common for you guys to barbecue back home, then why don't you send us a couple of comments at EnglishPod.com and we'll see everyone there.
segments.cn: 再见。
